required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Complex Intracranial Aneurysm Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Results of Revascularization Versus Endovascular Flow Diversion in Treatment of Complex Intracranial Aneurysms of Anterior Circulation

lead_sponsor.agency: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

clinical_study.source: Meshalkin Research Institute of Pathology of Circulation

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator expects that endovascular flow-diversion is superior over revascularization by postoperative modified Rankin scale (mRS) in patients with complex intracranial aneurysms.

detailed_description.textblock: Open, prospective, controlled randomized superiority trial is conducted. The hypothesis is that endovascular flow-diversion is better than revascularization in treatment of complex intracranial aneurysms by postoperative modified Rankin Scale (mRS). Sample size was measured by Fisher exact test. Depending on a type of the procedure, the patients are divided into two groups: Endovascular Flow Diversion Procedure (include 55 patients) and Revascularization Procedure (include 55 patients). Randomization is performed by random number generation.The study was approved by Institutional Review Board

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline modified Rankin Scale

secondary_outcome.description: Measured as: complete occlusion or residual aneurysm (included neck remnant)

secondary_outcome.measure: Major stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic) or neurological death related to the treatment of the target aneurysm

arm_group.description: Cerebral revascularization procedure with trapping of aneurysm

intervention.description: Implantation of flow-diverter in treatment of complex aneurysms of anterior circulation.
Cerebral revascularization with trapping of aneurysm in treatment of complex aneurysms of anterior circulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- anterior circulation complex intracranial aneurysm
- neck is more than 4 mm wide
- dome/neck ratio of aneurysm equals or less than 2:1
- age less than 75 years
- ability to give informed consent (subject or legally authorized representative)
- aneurysm is suitable for treatment to both procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- subarachnoid hemorrhage less than 30 days ago
- contraindications to endovascular treatment
- atypical aneurysms (mycotic, flow-related in patients with AVM, traumatic, false)
- informed consent refusal

facility.name: Novosibirsk Research Institution of Circulation Pathology
